item.title: Category I: Economic/PFM Expert
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Identification and Formulation of EU Action in Support of Public Administration and Public Finance Management

The specific objective of this assignment is to support the EU and the Government of Lao PDR in the identification and formulation of a range of possible interventions that can be developed into a governance programme, which includes both public administration and aspects of economic governance, namely public financial management.

The proposed interventions will improve, inter alia, transparency and accountability of PFM, promote fair and transparent domestic tax systems, improve domestic revenue mobilisation and procurement, increase the capacity and control of oversight bodies, strengthen the capacity of public administration in service delivery at national, provincial and local level while accompanying the institutional framework and the decentralisation process.

Project duration: 12 months

Category I: Economic/PFM Expert (38 working days)

Minimum required qualifications and skills:

  • Education at least up to Master’s Degree in Economics, Public Policy, Public Financial Management or other relevant fields or, in its absence, 15 years equivalent.

Professional experience:

  • Experience of at least 12 years in Public Finance Management, PFM assessments,fiscal policy and fiscal planning, programme budgeting, revenue policy and revenue management, macro-fiscal reporting public sector reforms and institutional strengthening and capacity development reforms;8
  • Experience of design of PFM support programmes.

Inter-personal and communication skills in English are essential and will be assessed during the telephone interviews (see paragraph on Management team member presence required or not for briefing and/or debriefing below).

Desirable qualifications and skills:

  • Experience of working in South East Asia
  • Experience of working in Lao PDR
  • Experience in formulation and/or implementation of sector policy support programmes with a budgetary support component in EU financed programmes.
